data.title: Kern County Teacher of the Year finalists named
data.meta_description: The finalists for Kern County Teacher of the Year have been announced.
data.text:
The finalists for Kern County Teacher of the Year have been announced.

They are:

Brian Devitt, Stockdale High School (Kern High School District); AP Microeconomics, CP Economics, Algebra 1, Financial Services, Virtual Enterprise

Yazmin Herrera, Almond Tree Middle School (Delano Union School District); 6th Grade Special Education

Veronica Karr, Rosamond High Early College Campus, (Southern Kern Unified School District); English

Devitt has been a teacher in the Kern High School District for 19 years. He is a member of three different departments, teaching AP Microeconomics, CP Economics, Algebra 1 and Virtual Enterprise, and serves as the active department chair of Career Technical Education (CTE). Brian also serves in an administrative role for two class periods helping staff with technology issues, assisting with discipline, running the truancy program, and supervising testing on campus, stated Kern County Superintendent of Schools (KCSOS).

Devitt led the Virtual Enterprise students at Stockdale High School to national rankings in 2019, 2021, 2022, and 2023 and the team ranked 3rd in the state in 2020. This past April, Brian took the Business Plan, Marketing and Finance team to compete in New York City.

Yazmin Herrera has been a special education teacher for the Delano Union School District for 11 years. She is a 6th-grade special education teacher who partners with two general education teachers in a co-teaching team. In addition to co-teaching, she also teaches reading, writing, and math for special education students who are not yet ready to be mainstreamed into the co-teaching setting, stated KCSOS.
